conversations.question: I'm interested in game development and want to study computer science in Germany. What programs would you recommend for me at TUM?
conversations.answer:
Based on your interest in game development and computer science, I would recommend the Master of Science program in Informatics: Games Engineering at the Technical University of Munich (TUM). This program is specifically designed for students who want to pursue a career in game development and combines computer science with game-related technologies.

The program covers topics such as game engines, computer graphics, and game development methodologies, and is taught in English. The program also includes an aptitude assessment process, which includes a written statement (max. 2 DIN-A4 pages) in English or German, explaining why you are a good fit for the program.

You can find more information about the program on the TUM website: [informatics-games-engineering-master-of-science-msc](https://www.tum.de/en/studies/master-studies/informatics-games-engineering-master-of-science-msc/).

conversations.question: What are the admission requirements for the Informatics Bachelor program? Do I need to know German?
conversations.answer: The Informatics Bachelor of Science (BSc) at TUM requires German: https://www.tum.de/en/studies/application/application-info-portal/admission-requirements/language-certificates#c48038. (Source: informatics-bachelor-of-science-bsc - Key Data)

conversations.question: When should I apply for Fall 2025 intake?
conversations.answer: I don't know enough information to answer your question. Please provide more details or contact TUM directly at study@tum.de for detailed assistance.
